boardgame.name: Bandu
Bausack
Bausack: Sac Noir
Sack o_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; Bricks
boardgame.description: Players take turns choosing blocks and giving them to each other to place on their structure. A player may pay a certain number of 'beans' to refuse a block and it gets passed to the next player. When a player's structure falls, they are out of the game. Last player standing wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Description of Bandu (1992, Milton Bradley, 2-6 players):_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Bandu is based upon the game of Bausack. Each player is given a base block and a number of beans. During a turn, a player chooses a wood block from a common supply and either holds a Refuse or Use auction. All player bid with their beans and the winner/loser must place the piece on their tower. If your tower falls you are out of the game. The last tower standing wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Description of Sac Noir (Rio Grande Games, 2-8 players):_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;There are five variations on how to play. The goal in all of them is to build a tower. The bag contains very different wooden pieces (i.e. an ashlar, an egg, a ring, a fir tree etc.) as well as a sack of beans for the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;auction variation_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; of the game. Depending on the variation you choose, either each player builds his own tower or all build one together. The _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;auction variations_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; are the most suspenseful and surprising. One might end up spending quite some beans to avoid building an especially difficult element. Gambling and bluffing abilities are needed just as much as a feeling for statics and construction skills. It's a game with almost endless building possibilities. It's a challenge for steady hands and shaky suspense for clever tacticians._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: BANDU 1991 Milton Bradley. Complete with 6 wood Bandu bases, 48 various hardwood objects, 30 bidding beans, instructions. All game pieces are in Excellent condition, nothing broken, cracked or damaged. Box has some wear but is very sturdy. Shipping weight is 3 pounds.

Played only by adults. This is actually the American edition, called _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Bandu._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Box has some shelf wear, but is very sturdy. All pieces are in excellent condition, and all pieces are present. High shipping cost is due to weight of game.
Bandu

BANDU 1991 Milton Bradley. Complete with instructions, 6 wood Bandu bases, 48 various hardwood objects, 30 bidding beans. The game was never used and is in Like New condition. The wood player bases never had the stickers attached, in fact the stickers are missing. Not a big deal since they are never needed to play and I like them for their looks without them. The box is nice accept for a place where a store sticker probably was and got ripped off, otherwise solid. A wonderful item for ones collection. Shipping weight is 4 pounds.

UK only The amazing tactical building game. Beautifully made in wood, this game can be played with 2-7 players. As well as a sensitive touch and a creative mind, you will need to assess risk, bluff and take the occasional gamble. Perfect for the young and young at heart. Games last between 10-60 minutes. Components: •70 wooden building block (approximately) •1 sack of beans •1 height measurer •1 instruction sheet with 5 game variations

English/French/German deluxe Sac Noir edition by Zoch Verlag. Complete and like new. This set has 63 black blocks (including black rule block) and 34 red blocks for a total of 97 blocks. It also includes the outer black cloth bag, a smaller inner black cloth bag, original English/French/German rules, a wood and string measuring tool, and the original dried kidney beans. Note the kind and number of pieces can vary slightly between Sac Noir sets. Some have reported as few as 80 blocks, and 97 seems to be a common good number. Compare with Bandu sets which have around 54 pieces and Bausack sets have around 70 pieces. Also, Sac Noir sets have more challenging block shapes than either.

This set includes BAUSACK AND BANDU. I bought both sets and kept it all in the Bausack box. That means there are even more blocks than the original Bausack.
